articles.author: JB, FinOps Product Dept. Director & Core CS Team Lead
articles.description:
New!
  
We are happy to announce that new damage deposit payment settings are now available in your Smily account. Those new settings will allow you to better manage your damage deposit payments, as well as provide a better experience to your guests.
Why the changes?
Up until now, when going to your general damage deposit payment management settings (in Settings > Payments > Default preferences), the only option available regarding the collection of your damage deposit was the collection time: either with bookings payment or on arrival.
Both options led to the damage deposit being due via the Smily payment link, and to wrong information being displayed on the Smily payment page and the Smily booking contract in case you were managing your damage deposit via a partner app such as Swikly.
Wh…
articles.title: New damage deposit payment management setting

articles.author: Yannick, Customer Care Team Leader - Pro Team
articles.description:
Action required
  
Following our recent messages concerning the changes needed for your website domains, we would like to inform you that we have extended the support for the previous configuration until April 10 2023.
If you have not made the needeed changes yet, please consult our manual article here.
If you need assistance doing the changes, please contact our support team and we will be happy to assist you with the modifications. Please make sure to have access to your registrar (Gandi, OVH, Godaddy…) so we can assist you in performing this change.
Thanks,
articles.title: Reminder - Important information regarding your website domain!

articles.description:
Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server allowed tailnets created by GitHub organizations which were subsequently renamed to be associated with a new GitHub organization with the previous name.
What happened?
Tailscale mapped tailnets created by GitHub organizations to their organization name, rather than to their organization ID. This meant that if a GitHub organization was renamed, and the previous name taken over by a new GitHub organization, the existing tailnet would be tied to the new GitHub organization instead of the original one.
Who is affected?
Up to 1,305 tailnets created by GitHub organizations may have been affected, if those GitHub organizations were renamed between 2021-06-18 and 2023-03-30 and fully relinquished the old GitHub organization name. Additiona…
articles.title: TS-2023-004

articles.description:
Reference: CVE-2023-28436
Severity: Medium
CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N
Description: A vulnerability identified in the implementation of Tailscale SSH in FreeBSD allowed commands to be run with a higher privilege group ID than that specified by Tailscale SSH access rules.
Affected platforms: FreeBSD
Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.38.2 or later
What happened?
A difference in the behavior of the FreeBSD setgroups system call from POSIX meant that the Tailscale client running on a FreeBSD-based operating system did not appropriately restrict groups on the host when using Tailscale SSH. When accessing a FreeBSD host over Tailscale SSH, the egid of the tailscaled process was used instead of that of the user specified in Tailscale SSH access rules.
Who is affected?
9 tailnets with 22 FreeBSD nodes running Tailscale SSH since Tailscale v1.34 (released on 2022-12-04) may have had Tailscale SSH sessions with a higher privilege group ID than that specified in Tailscale SSH access rules.
We have notified affected organizations where we have security contacts.
What is the impact?
Tailscale SSH commands may have been run with a higher privilege group ID than that specified in Tailscale SSH access rules if they met all of the following criteria:
The destination node was a FreeBSD device with Tailscale SSH enabled;
Tailscale SSH access rules permitted access for non-root users; and
A non-interactive SSH session was used.
What do I need to do?
If you are running Tailscale on FreeBSD, upgrade to v1.38.2 or later to remediate the issue. Admins of a tailnet can view FreeBSD nodes with unpatched versions in the admin console.
To update the local ports tree in advance of what’s available upstream, you can:
cd /usr/ports/security/tailscale
edit the Makefile to set PORTVERSION to 1.38.2
make makesum
make install
Tailscale SSH on other platforms is not affected.
Credits
We would like to thank Ryan Belgrave for reporting this issue.
articles.title: TS-2023-003

Apr 14, 10:19 PDT
Scheduled - The deprecation date for API Version 2021.12.31 is on March 31, 2023. Starting on April 17th, 2023, any applications that have not fully migrated will be automatically migrated to a newer version, which can result in application breakage.
Automatic migration will occur in phases as detailed in https://developer.airbnb.com/docs/versioning-enforcement
Phase 1 begins April 17, 2023 for the following endpoints: Transactions, Resolutions, Users, Opportunities
articles.title: v2021.12.31 Migration Enforcement

Scheduled - As announced on July 5, 2021 we are deprecating our XML API connection.
XML listings can no longer be activated: this means that new XML listings will remain unlisted even if you set 
true
. The same is valid for existing listing that are deactivated (i.e. you will not be able to reactivate a XML listing if it gets unlisted).
More information about this enforcement here: https://developer.airbnb.com/docs/enforcement
articles.title: XML Migration Enforcement

Mar 27, 15:42 PDT
Resolved - We have identified and resolved an internal issue that resulted in reservation webhook notifications being sent with $0 price. The incident was active between 13:40 and 14:20 PDT. Reservations payments were processed correctly, but nightly prices and fees appeared as $0 within the webhooks. Please use the GET Reservations API to retrieve the correct reservations prices. Alternatively, please contact the API Integrations team for additional help.
Apologies for the inconvenience.
articles.title: Reservation webhooks with $0 price

articles.description:
Incident began at 2023-04-17 18:43 and ended at 2023-04-17 20:54 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Mini Incident Report

We apologize for the inconvenience this service disruption/outage may have caused. We would like to provide some information about this incident below. Please note, this information is based on our best knowledge at the time of posting and is subject to change as our investigation continues. If you have experienced impact outside of what is listed below, please reach out to Google Workspace Support using help article https://support.google.com/a/answer/1047213.

(All Times US/Pacific)

Incident Start: 17 April 2023 11:43

Incident End: 17 April 2023 13:47

Duration: 2 hours, 4 minutes

Affected Services and Features:

Google Docs, Google Slides

Regions/Zones: Global

Description:

Google Docs and Google Slides experienced issues with actions involving images for a duration of 2 hours, 4 minutes. From preliminary analysis, the root cause of the issue was a recent change to a back-end storage policy. Google will complete a full Incident Report in the following days that will provide a full root cause.

Customer Impact:

Users may have experienced issues when performing actions involving images, including:

  • Uploaded images failing to render and displaying an exclamation mark
  • 500 errors when creating new documents from templates that included images

There was no impact to already existing Docs or Slides.

Additional details:

The issue was mitigated by rolling back the back-end storage policy changes at 13:47 PDT. Images uploaded while the issue was ongoing would remain broken and need to be reinserted.

Affected products: Google Docs
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're investigating reports of an issue with Google Docs. We will provide more information shortly.

articles.description:
Issue summary:


On April 16rd, 2023 from 12:11 PM PDT until 14:39 PM PDT, certain Android users on the Free plan reported issues with loading channels in the Android app.  


Upon investigation, this was attributed to the implementation of a data optimization feature, intended to improve app performance. We have rolled back this feature temporarily, which has corrected the observed issue.  A full investigation and remedy will take place prior to reimplementation. 


Thank you for your patience while we worked through this.  We apologize for any disruption to your work.
articles.title: Incident: Channels are missing for Android users

articles.description: This issue has now been resolved, please reload Slack to restore functionality to the direct messages view. Thank you for your patience while we worked on this.
articles.title: Incident: Direct messages view failing to load

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On April 10, 2023 at 7:30 PM PDT, some customers began experiencing delays when uploading files. We traced the issue back to a recent update made to how some file uploads are handled. Reverting this change fixed the issue, and customers were no longer experiencing it as of April 11, 2023 at 7:33 AM PDT. 


Thank you so much for your patience as our team actively worked on this.
articles.title: Incident: Images slow to upload

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

On April 3rd, 2023 from 11:00 AM PDT until 11:45 AM PDT, users on certain cellular service networks had issues receiving SMS texts for two-factor authentication (2FA). 


Upon investigation, this was traced to one unverified toll free number, which prevented 2FA codes from being approved for delivery. That number was removed from our 2FA pool, and services have resumed as usual. We are reviewing our process and alerting around outgoing phone number verification to ensure the issue doesn't happen again.
articles.title: Incident: Some users have trouble receiving 2FA code via SMS

articles.description:
Issue summary: 

From March 31st, 2023 at 7:18 PM PDT to April 1st, 2023 at 11:30 AM PDT, some customers may not have been able to sign in to Slack with the 'Continue with Google' feature. 


During a routine cleanup process, we made some changes to the project behind the 'Continue with Google' feature. This change inadvertently prevented the Slack mobile apps from confirming the validity of customer Google accounts during login. 


We reverted this change, restoring normal login behaviour for all affected customers, and we're working to ensure it does not happen again. We apologize for any disruption to your work.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are unable to sign-in using the Continue with Google feature on the Android and iOS app

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On March 28th, 2023 from 2:40 PM to 3:43 PM PDT, some customers may have experienced difficulties editing messages in Slack. 


We identified that this issue was caused by a recent code change. We reverted the code to resolve the issue for all impacted customers.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be unable to edit messages

articles.description:
The issue with navigation of back/forward in history functionality is now resolved for all users.


Please reload Slack (press Command/Control + Shift + R) and let us know if you are still running into any issues.


Thank you very much for your patience while we worked on getting this fix out the door.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may experience issues with using the back/forward in history functionality

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On March 21, 2023 at 7:32 AM PDT to March 22, 2023 at 8:06 AM PDT, the "Time when workflow started" variable is missing from all steps of the Workflow Builder for new and existing workflows. If the variable was used to publish to a Google Sheet, the cell would be empty.


We discovered a bug that made date fields invisible without any errors displayed, though workflows were still running and had access to the value.


We have released a fix on March 22, 2023 at 8:06 AM PDT. Previously impacted workflows need to retrieve the timestamps from the workflow in the Workflow Builder. We appreciate your patience while we sorted this out.
articles.title: Incident: “Time when workflow started” variable is missing from Workflow Builder steps
